snippet: Companies will be watching to see how Tom Wheeler responds to last month’s court decision that invalidated the rules created by the F.C.C. in 2011 to maintain an open Internet.
abstract: Telecommunications, media and Internet companies will be watching to see how Tom Wheeler, Federal Communications Commission chairman, responds to court decision that invalidated 2011 rules created by FCC to maintain open Internet; Wheeler says he can seize opportunity to assert commission's broad legal authority to enforce equality and equal access throughout networks in concept known as net neutrality.
lead_paragraph: Companies will be watching to see how Tom Wheeler responds to last month’s court decision that invalidated the rules created by the F.C.C. in 2011 to maintain an open Internet.

headline.main: Industry and Congress Await the F.C.C. Chairman’s Next Moves on Internet Rules
headline.print_headline: Industry and Congress Await the F.C.C. Chairman’s Next Moves on Internet Rules
